Dear Ms. Aufdemberge:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
January 7, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4146 Immunizations.
(2) If documentation of immunizations is unavailable,
immunizations shall begin within 30 calendar days of
admission, unless a statement from a physician indicating
that immunizations are contraindicated is included in the
resident’s record.
One resident was overdue for a vaccine upon admission. The
vaccine was due within the first 30 days but was not given until
five months after admission.
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all
of the following information shall be documented in the
case record within 14 days after discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the new
location of the child.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
The new location, and name and official title of the person to
whom she was discharged was not documented in one
resident’s case record. This was an isolated incident.
(repeat violation of both (a) and (f))
4

2.) The facility is in compliance will all ISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance will all DDHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. CONSULTATION
Per the MDHHS Mental Health Stabilization contract (page 46) which would include
all of the residents in Rose Hall, individual therapy shall occur more than once a
week.
For reporting accuracy, all staff, supervisors and managers must be sure to mark
the correct box(es) on incident reports when documenting restraints and seclusions.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
A staff person physically retaliated against a resident after the resident hit her in the
face and pulled out her hair extensions. That staff was terminated.
5

There were no other incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted three acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
One staff name-called a resident (verbal abuse) and was placed on a three-day
suspension.
Vista Maria’s policy for timely incident report writing was violated by two newly hired
staff. Those staff were retrained on the incident report policy.
One staff used unapproved CPI techniques by restraining a resident on the floor and
against a wall by herself. That staff was provided individual supervision by the Rights
Advisor and closely monitored by the Unit Manager for compliance with appropriate
restraint techniques.
Two staff improperly restrained a resident against a wall. Those staff were debriefed,
and alternative interventions were discussed by the Unit Manager. The supervisor
reviewed appropriate CPI techniques with staff at monthly meetings.
The following items were cited during the 2019 audit:
R 400.4147 Dental Care
R 400.4155 & R 400.4156 Timely Treatment Plans
R 400.4166 Discharge plan (repeat in 2020)
RFCAN Contract 2.10 Planned Discharge – Contact
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
